long_description: Here is the ultimate guide to the streets of one of the nation's most historic and fascinating cities, written by people who know them best. Edited by Robert Sloane. Softcover; 231 pages; 31 maps, 29 black-and-white photos. Appalachian Mountain Club; copyright 2003. Compiled by the tour guides of WalkBoston, the city's well-known pedestrian advocacy group. Guide reveals the secrets and charms of the real Boston. Inside you'll find 30 walks that explore the city's unique neighborhood, waterfronts and famous suburbs. Step-by-step directions, along with historic and cultural highlights make each walk easy to follow for locals and visitors alike. All walks are accessible by public transportation. Includes a detailed map for each walk.
short_description: Here is the ultimate guide to the streets of one of the nation's most historic and fascinating cities, written by people who know them best.
